summary: coVs are pleomorphic, enveloped, single-stranded, positive-sense RNA viruses. genomes of CoVs encode four structural proteins: spike (S), membrane (M), envelope (E) and nucleocapsid (N) the genomes of CoVs encode four structural proteins: spike (S), membrane (M), envelope (E), and nucleocapsid (N) using mAb 5E8, the N protein was visualized via immunofluorescence assay (IFA) and immunohistochemistry (IHC) the data indicated that 5E8 and 3D7 will be useful for unraveling the functions of the TGEV N protein. EV-N2 (aa 142–240), and pGEX-TGEV-N3 (aa 241–382) Enzyme F-GST-N1 CAGGATCCGCCAACCAGGGACAACGT Bam HI R-GST-N1 CACTCGAGGAATTTCAAAGCTTTGGAT Xho I F-GST-N3 CAGGATCCGATGTGTT Xho I F-GFP-N GTGAATTCAT sequences encoding aa189-202 (nt 565–606) and aa 246–257 of the N protein (nt 736–771) were produced by annealing complimentary primers. the sequences were inserted into the eukaryotic expression vector pEGFP-c2. pEGFP-TGEV-N, pEGFP-TGEV-N-189-202, pEGFP-TGEV-N-246-257, the cells were blocked with 5% skim milk and incubated with the primary antibody. the cells were visualized using the substrate 3-amino-9-ethylcarbazole. the cells were washed three times with PBST. protein A/G PLUS-Agarose was added to this mixture according to manufacturer's instructions. western blotting was performed as previously described. 83–302 SVSSILFGSYWTSKEDGDQI 184–203 NKKDDSVEQAVLAALKKLGV 297–316 EDGDQIEVTFTHKYHLPKDD 198–217 LKKLGVDTEKQQQRSRSKSK 311–330 HLPKDDPKTEQFLQQINAYA 212–231 SRSKSKERSNSKTRDTTPKN 325–344 QINAYARPSEVAKEQ animal immunization with aa 189-202-KLH or aa 246-257-KLH was terminated with 2M H2SO4. mice were immunized four times with aa 189-202-KLH or aa 246-257-KLH emulsified in complete Freund’s adjuvant (Sigma, USA) animals were fed sterilized food consisting of whole nutrient pellet feed. water was high-temperature-sterilized water that had been filtered three times. no animal was severely ill or died prior to the experimental endpoint. PK-15 cells were grown in DMEM medium supplemented with 5% fetal calf serum. TGEV infectious strain H was propagated on a PK-15 cell monolayer. cells were washed and incubated in fresh DMEM. the full-length N gene was amplified using the primers F-GFP-N and R-GFP-N (Table 1). Sequences encoding aa189-202 (nt 565–606) and aa 246–257 of the N protein (nt 736–771) were produced by annealing complimentary primers. pEGFP-TGEV-N, pEGFP-TGEV-N-189-202, and pEGFP-TGEV-N-246-257 were purified and transfected into PK-15 cells grown in 96-well plates using Attractene Transfection reagent (Qiagen, China) the fusion protein was purified using Glutathione Sepharose 4B (GE Healthcare, UK), according to the manufacturer’s instructions. the cells were visualized using the substrate 3-amino-9-ethylcarbazole. immunofluorescence assay (IFA) PK-15 cells infected with TGEV H strain (MOI of 0.1) were cultured for 36 h. the cells were fixed and blocked as described above. seven peptides spanning aa 142–240, six peptides spanning aa 184–203, ten peptides spanning aa 241–382 and five peptides spanning aa 241–260 were synthesized by GL Biotech (Shangai, China) Approximately 4 mg of the peptides (aa 189–202 or aa 246–257) coupled with keyhole limpet hemocyan ELISA plates were coated with purified recombinant protein (1 g/well) or synthesized peptide (2 g/well) at 37°C for 1 h. they were incubated with the culture supernatants of the 5E8 and 3D7 clones at 37°C for 1 h. the reaction was terminated with 2M H2SO4. mice were boosted with aa 189-202-KLH or aa 246-257-KLH (50 g per mouse) emulsified in complete Freund’s adjuvant (Sigma, USA) at two weeks after the first immunization. the mice were immunized four times. the water was high-temperature-sterilized water that had been filtered three times. the bottles of water were cleaned and disinfected before use and were replaced every day. no animal was severely ill or died prior to the experimental endpoint. two mAbs (5E8 and 3D7) against the TGEV N protein were produced using western blotting. the subtypes of mAb 5E8 and 3D7 were IgG2a and IgG2b. the PEDV mAb was maintained in the lab. Identification the epitopes of mAbs 5E8 and 3D7. overlapping polypeptides covering GST-N3 were synthesized. ELISA demonstrated that 3D7 reacted with aa 241–260. pEGFP-TGEV-N-189-202 and pEGFP-TGEV-N-246-257 reacted with mAb 3D7. identified epitope recognized by mAb 3D7 is located at the surface of the 3D structure of the TGEV N protein CTD. location of epitope for mAb 3D7 in the TGEV N protein CTD is highlighted. distribution of the N protein in PK-15 cells The epitope 189SVEQAVLAALKKLG202 is well conserved among Alpha-CoVs. ••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••• ••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••• the mAb 5E8 recognizes the N protein in the small intestines of animals inoculated with TGEV but not in control animals. the primary region of staining is located in the goblet cells of villi in the small intestine. peptide ELISA was used to examine humoral responses elicited by aa 189–202 and aa 246–257 epitopes. increased immune antibodies were observed in the sera of the groups immunized with aa 189-202-KLH or aa 246-257-KLH, collected on day 28 (14 days after the first boost). the cells were fixed with paraformaldehyde (4%) for 20 min at 4°C. the cells were blocked with 5% skim milk at 37°C for 1 h. the optimum concentration of the primary antibody was 0.5 ng/L. western blotting was used to identify epitopes of mAbs 5E8 and 3D7. 5E8 and 3D7 did not react with the PEDV N protein. the results of the peptide ELISA demonstrated that 5E8 reacted with aa184-203. further indirect epitope ELISA experiments revealed that 189SVEQAVLAALKKLG202 was the core amino acid sequence of the 5E8 epitope. pEGFP-TGEV-N-189-202 reacted with mAb 5E8. pEGFP-TGEV-N-246-257 reacted with mAb 3D7. epitope recognized by mAb 3D7 was 189SVEQAVLAALKKLG202. mAb 5E8 exhibited reactivity with the N protein in TGEV-infected PK-15 cells. the protein was found in both the nucleolus and cytoplasm of PK-15 cells. pEGFP-TGEV-N (encoding GFP-N) was transfected into PK-15 cells. ••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••• mAb 5E8 precipitated the TGEV N protein from TGEV-infected PK-15 cells. mAb 5E8 precipitated the protein from TGEV-infected PK-15 cells. the mAb 5E8 recognizes the N protein in the small intestines of animals inoculated with TGEV but not in control animals. the primary region of staining is located in the goblet cells of villi in the small intestine. antibody against aa 189–202 did not react with the N protein of TGEV-infected PK-15 cells. antibody responses elicited by aa 189–202 and aa 246–257 epitopes. IPMA method was optimized for TGEV detection. truncated N proteins (N1, N2 and N3) and peptide scanning were identified. mAbs against the TGEV N protein were obtained using a recombinant GST-N protein. IPMA and GFP did not merge very well. mAb 5E8 did not react with aa 189–201 and aa 190–202. mAb 3D7 did not react with aa 245–257 and aa 246–256 in the peptide ELISA analysis. previously identified three linear epitopes on the TGEV N protein do not overlap with the native TGEV N protein. previous studies have examined the function of the LKR in CoV N protein oligomerization. the LKR motif within aa 184–196 is crucial for N protein oligomerization. mAb 5E8 is the first antibody to recognize an epitope in the LKR region. the high conservation of the aa 189–202 epitope in the N protein is advantageous to the development of mAb 5E8 for diagnostic technologies. mAb 5E8 was used to reveal the location of the N protein during TGEV replication and to immunoprecipitate the N protein from lysates of TGEV-infected PK-15 cells. previous studies have reported that N protein nucleolar localization could not be detected in SARS-CoV-infected cells using antibodies against the N protein. active transport is required for proteins or nucleic acids greater than 40 kDa across the pore. the TGEV N protein is predicted to possess two NLSs.
